course_axis.name: category
course_axis.description: type of course content, e.g. chapter, sequential, vertical, problem, video, html

course_axis.name: index
course_axis.description: sequence index giving order in which this content appears within the course

course_axis.name: url_name
course_axis.description: unique database key for this module element of the course

course_axis.name: name
course_axis.description: human-readable name for this module element of the course

course_axis.name: gformat
course_axis.description: grading format, aka the name of the assignment into which this element's grade is aggregated

course_axis.name: module_id
course_axis.description: org/number/category/url_name for this element (note this leaves out the semester-ID, and while it is unique within a course, is not unique across semester re-runs)

course_axis.name: path
course_axis.description: slash separated path of url_name's to this element, from the course root; gives parents for the element, including chapter and section

course_axis.name: data
course_axis.description: additional data associated with this element of the course, e.g. you-tube ID for videos

fields.name: ytid
fields.description: youtube ID of video element, or of youtube video within an iframe in an HTML element

fields.name: group_id_to_child
fields.description: children in A/B test partition (for split_test)

fields.name: itype
fields.description: Problem type for problems found in course.xml - only searches within a list of known problem types

fields.name: num_items
fields.description: Number of problem sub-parts, or the number of ptypes found in a single problem

fields.name: has_solution
fields.description: Boolean as to whether a solution exists in the problem.

fields.name: has_image
fields.description: Boolean as to whether the problem contains an image.

course_axis.name: chapter_mid
course_axis.description: module-id of chapter within which this module element exists

course_axis.name: graded
course_axis.description: boolean specifying if the seciton (aka sequential) has graded content or not

course_axis.name: is_split
course_axis.description: boolean specifying if this element is in a split_test or not

course_axis.name: split_url_name
course_axis.description: url_name for the split_test if this element is within a split_test
